instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00239: What is 820-00239? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1706: What is A1706? A1706 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3071, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00239, 820-00923..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Fully Functional except no audio
threads.message: Slight liquid-damage on an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>. Area around a CPU chip was slightly corroded. Ultrasonic got it going, but no audio. No audio device showing up in Audio hardware system information. Audio system preferences is not showing any devices for Output or Input. Headphone jack does nothing also. Any thoughts?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Fully Functional except no audio
threads.message:
there is often some inductor that blows between audio IC & power rail, but...finding hat without schematic or boardview on a totally new design... good luck with that.

It will usually be visibly blown, burned, have a tiny hole in the middle, or have a small solder ball next to it. Only thing to do is to look.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Fully Functional except no audio
threads.message: Thanks, yeah, I'm familiar with that inductor on other models and how it likes to blow. I've been trying to find it. Right now I'm trying to determine where the audio circuit is.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Fully Functional except no audio
threads.message: Does anyone have any ideas where the audio section might be on this board? I'm kind of stuck. The pictures above are pre-ultrasonic cleaning so that's all the clues I'm working with.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Fully Functional except no audio
threads.message: According to an ifixit teardown, in your first photo, the upper right hand of the board, the IC is the Cirrus Logic CS42L83A Audio Codec... I'd start there...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Fully Functional except no audio
threads.message: That's great, thanks for the tip. I'll start with that.
